title: If humans have been civilized for thousands of years, does that make civilization a natural state rather than an artificial one? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is a very interesting question which “begs” the question: “What does it mean to be civilized?!” Who decided that we are civilized. Of course, it was us, we determined ourselves that we became civilized because we wear clothes, we eat in a certain way, we behave according to certain social norms. Mostly we separate ourselves from other animals by this distinction, or this is how we separate social classes naming one class more civilized than others. But this is all artificial! It is all subjective, and it is always according to the most accepted, prevalent values in a given society! Are we actually civilized according to Nature’s system, Nature’s laws?! The answer would be a resounding NO! We are the most barbaric creatures who - with all of their pompous sophistication - destroy everything around them until they also destroy themselves. We cause constant misery for our own species, survive at each other’s expense, and create slavery in all kinds of different forms. At the same time, all other elements in nature from the inanimate to vegetative and animate are instinctively integrated into the system, only serving the wellbeing of the whole, even at their own expense. Humanity will become civilized when we learn how to live within the fully integrated and interdependent framework of Nature and use our technological, cultural sophistication for the benefit of the whole system. Then we will merit the title of “crown of evolution”, the most advanced, civilized species in the system. Believe it or not, this question is probably at least a couple of centuries or so old. People used to ask it seriously all the time, particularly regarding European societies. The answer is, as far as I’m concerned anyway, no. Civilization is entirely artificial, albeit there are more natural influences (such as territorialism, hierarchies and sexual dynamics) than are ever admitted to.

If humans have been civilized for thousands of years, does that make civilization a natural state rather than an artificial one? By current anthropological reckoning, human beings have been on earth for at least 200,000 years. In terms of available relics, human civilization and religions, are not older than 6 to 7 thousand years. This would suggest that civilization, like religious tolerance, is not exactly a natural state of human societies. Peace! 14 June 2020

We need to be careful about what we mean by ‘natural’. Sometimes it’s used to mean “without human interference” in which case it doesn’t make sense to apply to humans. If you consider humans part of nature however then everything we do is natural. In other circumstances it seems to be used as a synonym for “normal” but that doesn’t apply here.

Man is a part of nature. Tool use is common in nature. Social structure is common in nature. Social structure is an effective tool of survival, which is the reason it is common. Civilization, whatever it is, is a social structure which has survived because it is a useful tool for survival. It follows that civilization is a natural state for mankind.
